title: Unleashing the Power of Natural Audio Featuring Multiple Sound Sources
author: Xize Cheng (Zhejiang University), Slytherin Wang, Zehan Wang, Rongjie Huang, Tao Jin, Zhou Zhao, ...
relevance_why: This paper focuses on universal sound separation and proposes innovative techniques that leverage natural audio, which can provide insights into audio-visual models and multi-modal learning relevant to Haohe Liu's research in audio generation and restoration.
background: Universal sound separation aims to isolate distinct audio signals from a mixture, improving how machines perceive and manipulate real-world audio.
contribution: This paper introduces ClearSep, a data engine framework that separates naturally mixed audio into independent tracks, achieving state-of-the-art performance in sound separation tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods largely depended on artificially mixed audio, limiting their applicability to real-world scenarios and often resulting in lower performance in complex acoustic environments.
technical_comparison.novelty: ClearSep actively utilizes naturally mixed audio samples for training, combined with a two-stage iterative process that enhances model robustness and separation accuracy.

key_innovation: The integration of unsupervised remix-based evaluation metrics allows for effective assessment of sound separation without needing ground-truth references.
real_world_impact: ClearSep has significant potential for improving audio applications in music production, environmental sound analysis, and even enhancing audio clarity in communication technologies.

new_terms.universal sound separation: **Universal sound separation** refers to the ability of a system to isolate multiple different sound events from mixed audio, regardless of their classifications.
new_terms.reverberant environments: **Reverberant environments** are spaces where sound waves reflect off surfaces, creating a delayed echo effect, complicating the isolation of individual audio signals.

open_sourcing: All code and models will be made publicly available.
